website_summaries.verdict: The Norvan LD is the embodiment of a premium trail running shoe, claimed many experts. It features superior cushioning, delivering maximum all-day comfort that a lot of the runners appreciate. The sticky grip of the shoe has been one of the most lauded qualities of the shoe, allowing the shoe to basically tread through any type of terrain. Being put under different terrain tests, the shoe has been able to withstand harsh elements and has received various praise for maintaining durability.
pros: According to numerous reviewers, the Arc’teryx Norvan LD delivers a smooth and comfortable ride
The fit of the shoe is excellent, some users claimed
Numerous runners commend the sticky grip delivered by the shoe
The shoe has a highly versatile and aggressive traction, remarked many testers
A lot of reviewers state that the shoe is able to withstand various wearing elements
Various runners appreciate the stable ride delivered by the shoe
The lacing system is secure and clean, expressed many wearers
The Norvan LD is highly durable
it is a long-wearing shoe, many experts observed
cons: The shoe is slightly heavy for a lightweight running shoe, as commented by some experts
Some users have expressed their dismay over the shoe’s stiff underfoot
The Arc’teryx Norvan LD is quite expensive, a few people pointed

customer_reviews.title: Arc’teryx shoes
customer_reviews.text: Arc’teryx is an excellenct company with quaility products. Though they run a little small everything is true to size. Same goes for these shoes. A little snug but I’d rather have snug fitting outerwear then loose and damaged. Shoes are build to last and look great. Nice material but can be hot at time. Not as breathable as I hoped but no hotspot when walking so I guess they do the job. I would but again.
customer_reviews.author: TheDudeman

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Shoe
customer_reviews.text: I used these shoes to hike the Camino de Santiago. I waked 500 miles (800km) in them and absolutely loved the product. No blisters! They breathe very well and the sole was able to hand multiple terrain. They did start to tear on the front side after 300 miles but that’s to be expected. Great product!
customer_reviews.author: Gabriel Griego

customer_reviews.title: Sometimes you actually get what you pay for
customer_reviews.text: And these shoes are no exception. Nice quality and good fit.
customer_reviews.author: OUgasman

customer_reviews.title: Too pricey and not good
customer_reviews.text: Not happy with the running shoes. It still hurts ...I guess the shape is not right Still think Nike’s are the best

customer_reviews.title: Finally a trail running shoe that isn't full of gimmicks.
customer_reviews.text: This shoe fits great, it is stripped free of gimmicky features. I've had my pair for a few months now and they are holding up great. I can't recommend these enough. It's as if the designers actually went running in the shoe they made. It's for me a perfect shoe.
